IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO PROVIDE LOW-INCOME, FIRST GENERATION-TO-COLLEGE STUDENTS WITH THE TOOLS, RESOURCES, AND OPPORTUNITIES NECESSARY FOR ADMISSION TO AND SUCCESS IN COLLEGE.
IRS990.MissionDesc: TO PROVIDE LOW-INCOME, FIRST GENERATION-TO-COLLEGE STUDENTS WITH THE TOOLS, RESOURCES, AND OPPORTUNITIES NECESSARY FOR ADMISSION TO AND SUCCESS IN COLLEGE.
IRS990.Desc: PRE-COLLEGE PROGRAMS: PHILADELPHIA FUTURES' DIRECT SERVICE PROGRAMS (SPONSOR-A-SCHOLAR FOUNDED IN 1990 AND COLLEGE CONNECTION LAUNCHED IN 2013) PROVIDE A COMPREHENSIVE ARRAY OF SERVICES AND RESOURCES TO REMOVE THE BARRIERS THAT HAVE TRADITIONALLY PREVENTED LOW-INCOME, FIRST-GENERATION-TO-COLLEGE STUDENTS FROM ACHIEVING COLLEGE SUCCESS. OUR PRE-COLLEGE PROGRAMS SERVE STUDENTS ATTENDING PHILADELPHIA PUBLIC, PUBLIC CHARTER AND PAROCHIAL HIGH SCHOOLS. OUR PRE-COLLEGE PROGRAMS OFFER (I) YEAR-ROUND ACADEMIC ENRICHMENT; (II) PERSONALIZED COLLEGE GUIDANCE; (III) FINANCIAL INCENTIVES; (IV) EXTRACURRICULAR CLUBS AND ACTIVITIES; (V) GENDER-SPECIFIC PROGRAMMING; AND (VI) INDIVIDUALIZED STAFF SUPPORT.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: COLLEGE RETENTION AND SUCCESS SERVICES: PHILADELPHIA FUTURES' COLLEGE RETENTION AND SUCCESS SERVICES PROVIDE STUDENTS PARTICIPATING IN OUR DIRECT SERVICE PROGRAMS (SPONSOR-A-SCHOLAR AND COLLEGE CONNECTION) WITH INDIVIDUALIZED COUNSELING AND GUIDANCE THROUGH COLLEGE. IN ADDITION TO STAFF SUPPORT, COLLEGIANS RECEIVE FUNDS FOR COLLEGE RELATED EXPENSES, CAREER COUNSELING AND A CONNECTION TO INTERNSHIP OPPORTUNITIES THROUGH PHILADELPHIA FUTURES' CAREER FUTURES INITIATIVE. COLLEGE RETENTION STAFF ALSO SUPPORT OUR STRATEGIC PARTNERSHIPS WITH A RANGE OF PENNSYLVANIA COLLEGES AND UNIVERSITIES.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: OUTREACH FUTURES: PHILADELPHIA FUTURES' OUTREACH FUTURES INITIATIVE BRINGS THE ORGANIZATION'S SERVICES AND EXPERTISE TO THE BROADER COMMUNITY. OUTREACH FUTURES OFFERS A RANGE OF PROGRAMS AND SERVICES TO STUDENTS, FAMILIES AND YOUTH-SERVING PROFESSIONALS THROUGHOUT PHILADELPHIA. A KEY COMPONENT OF PHILADELPHIA FUTURES' OUTREACH SERVICES IS THE ANNUAL PUBLICATION OF STEP UP TO COLLEGE: PHILADELPHIA'S GUIDE TO THE COLLEGE PREPARATION, APPLICATION AND ADMISSIONS AND FINANCIAL AID PROCESSES. OVER 40,000 COPIES OF THE GUIDE ARE DISTRIBUTED TO HIGH SCHOOL STUDENTS, COMMUNITY-BASED ORGANIZATIONS AND THE FREE LIBRARY OF PHILADELPHIA WITHOUT COST TO REMOVE ANY BARRIERS TO ACCESS. CONTENT FROM THE GUIDE ALSO IS AVAILABLE THROUGH DIGITAL MEDIA.

ProgSrvcAccomActyOtherGrp.Desc: PHILADELPHIA FUTURES HAS A CONTRACT WITH THE CHARLES E. ELLIS TRUST TO ADMINISTER FUNDS TO ELIGIBLE PHILADELPHIA HIGH SCHOOL GIRLS FOR TUITION AND EDUCATIONAL ENRICHMENT. EXPENSES ARE THOSE ASSOCIATED WITH THE ADMINISTRATION OF THE TRUST. ADDITIONALLY, PHILADELPHIA FUTURES ADMINISTERED 2 PROGRAMS IN PHILADELPHIA WHICH AWARDED STUDENTS FOR THEIR ACADEMIC ACCOMPLISHMENTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: PHILADELPHIA FUTURES HAS A CONTRACT WITH CHARLES E. ELLIS TRUST ("THE TRUST") TO ACT AS AGENT ADMINISTRATOR FOR THE TRUST. AS AGENT ADMINISTRATOR, PHILADELPHIA FUTURES IS RESPONSIBLE FOR THE ADMINISTRATION OF THE ANNUAL DISTRIBUTION OF FUNDS TO PHILADELPHIA HIGH SCHOOL GIRLS FOR TUITION AND ENRICHMENT PURPOSES. THE TRUST PAYS PHILADELPHIA FUTURES AN ANNUAL FEE FOR THOSE SERVICES.
PERMANENTLY RESTRICTED NET ASSETS ARE RESTRICTED TO INVESTMENT IN PERPETUITY. THE INCOME GENERATED FROM THE ENDOWMENT IS USED TO SUPPORT VARIOUS PROGRAMS OF THE ORGANIZATION.

TO ACCESS THE SPONSORSHIP FUNDS, STUDENTS MEET IN PERSON WITH A STAFF MEMBER FROM PHILADELPHIA FUTURES' OFFICE OF COLLEGE RETENTION AND SUCCESS AT LEAST TWICE EACH YEAR TO DISCUSS GRADES FROM THE PRIOR SEMESTER, THEIR ROSTERS FOR THE UPCOMING SEMESTER, AND THEIR OVERALL CAREER ASPIRATIONS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: A COPY OF 990 IS REVIEWED BY THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE, EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR, AND BOARD OF DIRECTORS BEFORE FILING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST SURVEY IS DISTRIBUTED ANNUALLY TO THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS BIANNUALLY EVALUATES THE PERFORMANCE OF THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR AND DETERMINES COMPENSATION USING COMPARABILITY DATA. FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15: LINE 15(B) THE ORGANIZATION HAS NO OTHER KEY EMPLOYEES, AND OFFICERS ARE NOT COMPENSATED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION HAS A COMMITTEE THAT HAS OVERSIGHT OF THE AUDIT OF ITS FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. THERE HAS BEEN NO CHANGE SINCE THE PRIOR YEAR.
